articles.author: Manas Mishra
articles.title: REFILE-US STOCKS-Wall St kicks off 2020 at record levels on China stimulus, trade hopes
articles.description: U.S. stocks extended their rally into the new year, with all three major indexes hitting record highs on Thursday, as fresh stimulus from Beijing to prop up its economy added to optimism fueled by easing trade tensions and an improving global outlook.
articles.content:
(Corrects to “Microsoft Corp” from “Microsoft Inc” in paragraph 9) 
* China cuts banks’ reserve ratios again to spur economy 
* U.S. weekly jobless claims fall 
* Hanesbrands slips after report of Wells Fargo downgrade 
* Indexes up: Dow 0.59%, S&P 0.… [+2536 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Saudi Arabia condemns attacks on U.S. embassy in Baghdad
articles.description: Saudi Arabia condemned attacks on the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad, the Saudi foreign ministry said in statement published by the kingdom's official press agency on Thursday.
articles.content:
CAIRO (Reuters) - Saudi Arabia condemned attacks on the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad, the Saudi foreign ministry said in statement published by the kingdom’s official press agency on Thursday.

articles.author: Denis Dumo
articles.title: Prominent South Sudan economist, 30 others pardoned by President Kiir
articles.description: South Sudan's President Salva Kiir on Thursday pardoned dozens of prisoners including a prominent economist jailed for giving interviews to foreign media, saying it was a goodwill gesture to rejuvenate the country's stalled peace process.
articles.content: JUBA (Reuters) - South Sudan’s President Salva Kiir on Thursday pardoned dozens of prisoners including a prominent economist jailed for giving interviews to foreign media, saying it was a goodwill gesture to rejuvenate the country’s stalled peace process.   … [+1722 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Castro drops out of presidential race
articles.description: Julian Castro, the grandson of a Mexican immigrant who became San Antonio mayor and a U.S. housing secretary, suspended his 2020 Democratic presidential run on Thursday. Jillian Kitchener reports.
articles.content:
Posted 
Julian Castro, the grandson of a Mexican immigrant who became San Antonio mayor and a U.S. housing secretary, suspended his 2020 Democratic presidential run on Thursday. Jillian Kitchener reports.
